timeAnchors.definition: The initiation of ABBV-951 (study drug) administration
timeAnchors.sourceText: The Treatment Period starts with the initiation of ABBV-951... On the morning of Day 1 (V3) subjects will need to be in a clinically defined "Off" state (i.e., no PD medications for at least 12 hours before initiation of study drug).

repetitions.sourceText: following CSCI for 28 days with a fixed indwelling catheter at a rate of 0.1 or 0.25 mL/hour
ABBV-951 was administered as a loading dose followed by a continuous infusion for up to 72 hours
infusion of ABBV-951 at the same concentration (50/200 mg/mL), but at a higher infusion rate (0.5 mL/hour) for fewer days (5 days) was well tolerated

traversalConstraints.sourceText: [{'condition': 'If subject experiences AE requiring discontinuation', 'path': ['EARLY_TERMINATION', 'FOLLOW_UP']}, {'condition': 'In countries where PKG watch is not approved', 'path': ['REDUCED_MONITORING_PERIOD']}]

executionTypes.rationale: Assessment of eligibility is performed once at the start of the study to determine subject participation.
ABBV-951 is delivered via continuous infusion over a period of time to maintain steady levodopa exposure.
The loading dose is a one-time administration preceding the start of continuous infusion.
Adjustments to infusion rates and extra doses are based on individual patient needs and clinical response (decision points).
Infusion site findings and irritation are monitored repeatedly throughout the treatment period.
Laboratory assessments are scheduled at specific intervals to monitor for potential increases in phosphate levels.

footnoteConditions.text: 8. Subject must have a diagnosis of levodopa-responsive idiopathic PD.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: 8. Subject must have a diagnosis of levodopa-responsive idiopathic PD.

footnoteConditions.text: 9. Subject must meet the following disease activity criteria:  Must be taking a regimen of oral medications for PD that has remained unchanged for at least 30 days before commencing ABBV-951 (rescue medications taken "as needed" may be disregarded when assessing whether the regimen of oral medications has remained unchanged); this regimen must include levodopa-containing formulations such as CD/LD IR (e.g., Sinemet, Madopar), CD/LD-CR (e.g., Sinemet controlled release [CR]), CD/LD extended release (e.g., Rytary), CD/LD/entacapone (e.g., Stalevo).  Must have a recognizable/identifiable "Off" and "On" state (motor fluctuations) as established through investigator observation and confirmed by PD diary entries recorded during the concordance test performed during the Screening Period.b
footnoteConditions.sourceText: 9. Subject must meet the following disease activity criteria:  Must be taking a regimen of oral med

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Adverse Event Incidence

timeWindow.reference: First infusion to end of study

endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: (Count of subjects with >= 1 event / Total subjects in Safety Analysis Set) * 100
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Descriptive summary of percentage of subjects with AEs, SAEs, and AESIs
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Percentage of subjects with adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs) during the study; Percentage of subjects with AEs of special interest (AESIs) during the study

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Infusion Site Tolerability
inputs: Infusion Site Evaluation Scale numeric grade
Infusion Site Evaluation Scale letter grade
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Percentage of subjects with numeric grade >= 5 OR letter grade >= D
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Descriptive summary of high-grade site reactions
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Percentage of subjects with numeric grade equal to or higher than 5 and percentage of subjects with letter grade equal to or higher than D on the Infusion Site Evaluation Scale at any time during the

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Safety Parameter Change from Baseline
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Descriptive statistics (mean, SD, min, median, max) of change
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Change in clinical laboratory test data from Baseline to end of study; Change in vital sign measurements from Baseline to end of study; Change in electrocardiograms (ECGs) from Baseline to end of stud

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Normalized Daily Off/On Time
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: (Reported hours / Total diary hours) * 24 - Baseline normalized value
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Paired-sample t-test for change from Baseline
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Average normalized daily "Off" time and "On" times as assessed by the PD Diary

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: PD Symptom Severity (MDS-UPDRS)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: End of study score - Baseline score
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Paired-sample t-test for change from Baseline
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: PD symptoms as assessed by the Movement Disorder Society-Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (MDS-UPDRS) Parts I-IV

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Quality of Life and Sleep
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: End of study score - Baseline score
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Paired-sample t-test for change from Baseline
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Sleep symptoms as assessed by the PD Sleep Scale-2 (PDSS-2); Quality of life as assessed by the PD Questionnaire-39 items (PDQ-39); Health-related quality of life as assessed by the EuroQol 5-dimensio

derivedVariables.name: Percentage of subjects with adverse events (AEs)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: (Number of subjects with at least one AE / Total number of subjects) * 100

derivedVariables.name: Percentage of subjects with Infusion Site Evaluation Scale numeric grade >= 5
sourceVariables: Infusion Site Evaluation Scale numeric grade
derivedVariables.derivationRule: (Number of subjects with numeric grade >= 5 at any time / Total number of subjects) * 100

derivedVariables.name: Change in clinical laboratory test data from Baseline
derivedVariables.derivationRule: End of study value - Baseline value
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last value prior to initial study drug administration

derivedVariables.name: Change in vital sign measurements from Baseline
derivedVariables.derivationRule: End of study value - Baseline value
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last value prior to initial study drug administration

derivedVariables.name: Average normalized daily Off time
derivedVariables.derivationRule: (End of study normalized Off time) - (Baseline normalized Off time)
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Assessed via PD Diary prior to treatment

derivedVariables.name: Change in MDS-UPDRS Parts I-IV
derivedVariables.derivationRule: End of study total score - Baseline total score

derivedVariables.name: Change in PDSS-2
derivedVariables.derivationRule: End of study total score - Baseline total score

derivedVariables.name: Change in PDQ-39
derivedVariables.derivationRule: End of study total score - Baseline total score

derivedVariables.name: Change in EQ-5D-5L
derivedVariables.derivationRule: End of study total score - Baseline total score
